title: How to read, understand and remember quickly - Quora

response.answer_text: Learning is a life long process. Try to read everyday and after 2 years you will be amazed by how much you read. Consistent effort in long run is a key to improvement. And as with anything if you do reading everyday you will start learning quickly. To understand quickly, try to understand the material in layman's term and explain it to others. Teaching what you have learned cements the concept in your own head. There is no magic to learn quickly, people who seem to have that ability has done a lot as a kid. If you ever get time, try reading ‘Mastery', it would give you a good insight of what makes few people master their choosen profession.

Start slow and simple. Years ago there used to be something call SRA Reading Laboratory in the US. They taught reading comprehension to children. Most children hated these little reading assignments but if you wanted to read and read well they were invaluable. Simply explained, they are short reading assignments followed up by questions to test your comprehension. That is the secret. You have to read in small amounts and then do a self assessment on what you have read. Over time, increase the size of your readings, reading more and assessing your comprehension fewer times. Generally, it is a good idea to minimize distractions when you are reading. The more you can focus, the more you can absorb.
Take a course in speed reading. Your reading speed will increase and so will your comprension as it focuses your mind. Also, it's cool to be able to read a book in an hour.
